description: Raising roof ridge and eaves height; two additional pitched dormer windows to the side; insert 2.No rooflights on side roof slopes; external alterations.
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions:
The 2.No proposed dormer window(s) in
the east elevation shall: (a) be of purpose-made obscure glass, (b) be
permanently fixed closed below a height of 1.7m above finished floor level, and
shall thereafter be retained in that form.

All rooflights hereby permitted shall be
conservation style rooflights set as flush as practicable within the roof
slope.

The development hereby permitted shall
not commence until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of
the external surfaces noted below have been submitted to, and approved in
writing by, the local planning authority: (a) tile hanging(s). The development
shall be completed in accordance with the approved details and shall thereafter
be retained.

<p>The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Proposed Block Plan entitled Drawing No: 2331/PL.003;</li><li>Proposed Site Plan entitled Drawing No: PL.020;</li><li>Proposed Section Plan entitled Drawing No: PL.030;</li><li>Proposed Second Floor Plan entitled Drawing No: PL.202 Rev B;</li><li>Amended&nbsp;Proposed Roof Plan entitled Drawing No: PL.203 Rev B;</li><li>Amended Proposed Sections AA and Elevations Plan entitled Drawing No: PL.210 Rev A;</li><li>Heritage Statement entitled Ref: 2404.1474;</li><li>External Daylight and Sunlight Study entitled Ref: 11611 Rev0;</li></ul>

The materials to be used in the
construction of the external surfaces of&nbsp;the works proposed to include tile hangings and/or any
making good, together with any window frames/type and their designs hereby permitted shall match those
used in the existing building and/or materials and finishes as specified on
amended elevations which form part the approved plans list.

The development hereby permitted shall
be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
